author: Kang Yoon-seung
title: Samsung Electronics' DRAM market share down in H1: report
text:
Samsung Electronics' DRAM market share down in H1: report
All News17:13 August 14, 2025
SEOUL, Aug. 14 (Yonhap) -- Samsung Electronics Co. said Thursday its market share for dynamic random access memory (DRAM) products fell in the first half from a year earlier amid intensifying global competition.
The South Korean tech giant took up 32.7 percent of the global DRAM market over the January-June period, down 8.8 percentage points from a year earlier, according to the company's report.
Samsung Electronics, on the other hand, accounted for 19.9 percent of the global smartphone market in the first half, up from 18.3 percent a year earlier.
The company also held 28.9 percent of the TV market over the six-month period, slightly up from 28.3 percent last year.
The average sales price of TVs fell 4 percent in the first quarter compared with the annual average of 2024, while those of smartphones rose 1 percent, the report also showed.
Samsung Electronics invested 18 trillion won (US$12.9 billion) in research and development projects in the first half, registering 5,005 patents in South Korea and 4,594 in the United States, it added.
colin@yna.co.kr
(END)
